column2: MASSACHUSETTS DMV TEST
Question Text
1. ABS is the acronym for:
2. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
3. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
4. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive with the flow of traffic.
column6: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column10: drive slower than the flow of traffic.

column2: 5. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers are not required to stop.
column6: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column8: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.
column10: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 7. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Not drinking over a period of time.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column6: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 9. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way

column2: 11. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column6: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column8: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 12. Which shape is a stop sign?
13. This road sign means:
14. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
15. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 16. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
17. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column6: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column10: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 18. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column8: to turn on your windshield wipers.
column10: to look for road edge markings to guide you.

column2: 19. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column8: turn left into the one-way road.
column10: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.

column2: 20. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
21. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
22. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to brake sharply and stop.

column2: 23. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: slow down and enter the intersection.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: Pass only in the right lane
column8: Cars in right lane must slow down

column2: 25. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column8: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column10: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
